snippet: The climate has cooled toward stocks with full exposure to market’s oscillations, spawning new products that cater to those who hate market volatility.
abstract: Investment climate has cooled toward stocks with full exposure to the market’s ups and downs following the volatility of 2011; new products are emerging aimed at more moderate investors who have no taste for market volatility and remain more invested in protecting principal than growing their assets; new generation of 'low-volatility' exchange-traded funds focus on established companies with consistent earnings flow and dividends.
lead_paragraph: The climate has cooled toward stocks with full exposure to market’s oscillations, spawning new products that cater to those who hate market volatility.

headline.seo: As the Market Lurches, New Options to Avoid Getting Seasick
headline.main: As Markets Lurch, Options to Avoid Getting Seasick
headline.print_headline: As Markets Lurch, Options to Avoid Getting Seasick
